story: Jumbo, one of the most famous elephants in history, was sold to P.T. Barnum and toured North America.
He tragically died in a railway accident in St. Thomas, Ontario, which cemented his legacy in the region.
African elephants are native to the continent of Africa and are the largest land animals on Earth.
The Asian elephant is the largest living land animal in Asia and is native to several countries on the continent.
The first elephant to arrive in Australia was brought over for a menagerie in Hobart, Tasmania in 1851.
